title: Azwan Aripin
text:
Muhammad Azwan bin Aripin (born 21 April 1996) is a Malaysian <a href="Association%20football">footballer</a> who plays as a <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29%23Full-back">left-back</a> or <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29%23Wing-back">wing-back</a> for <a href="Malaysia%20Super%20League">Malaysia Super League</a> club <a href="Penang%20F.C.">Penang</a>.
Azwan began his career with Kelantan's youth team in 2014 before being promoted to first team in August 2016. Azwan was the captain for the Kelantan U19 that won the <a href="Malaysia%20Youth%20League">Malaysia Youth League</a> title in 2014. He also was part of the Kelantan U21 team that won the <a href="Malaysia%20President%27s%20Cup">President's Cup</a> in 2016.
Club career.
Kelantan.
On 28 October 2017, Azwan made his debut for Kelantan in a 1–3 win over <a href="Melaka%20United">Melaka United</a> in a league last match. On 11 November 2017, it was announced that Azwan will be retained for another season with Kelantan. For <a href="2018%20Kelantan%20FA%20season">2018 season</a>, Azwan made his season first appearance in 1–1 draw against <a href="Terengganu%20F.C.%20I">Terengganu</a> on 6 February 2018.
Penang.
Azwan joined newly promoted club <a href="Penang%20F.C.">Penang</a> in December 2020. He made his league first appearance in 2–0 defeat to <a href="Johor%20Darul%20Ta%27zim%20F.C.">Johor Darul Ta'zim</a> on 9 March 2021.
Honours.
Club.
Kelantan U19
Kelantan U21
